reviewText:
I took the plunge, having played the title when if was first released, and I have to say that this is worse than even I recall it being.
To make matters even worse, ship recognition is still in play as a form of DRM, and with no manuals or ship recognition guides (the ones that came with the boxed release) it's hit & miss guessing. And, like the original, if you guess wrongly 3 times, you are tossed into the same scenerio time and time again. There has been no effort at all made in bringing this to Steam!

Aside from this pain, and it is a pain, my main issues:

1/ No sound...literally! Just noticed on the Store Page that Full Audio Support is not ticked....very crafty!

2/ Graphics are incredibly appalling (even granted it's age, and after maxing it out using F10). So bad it is quite unplayable unless playing only on the map.

**The Store Page screenshots are a lie quite simply, giving the impression that the game's visuals have been smoothed and improved.They haven't...it is jagged and plain ugly!
False advertising? Hell Yes!**

3/ Mouse panning is jagged and very sluggish (as if my PC is struggling with uber graphics settings) and makes aiming at the jagged blob that could be a ship a right pain.

4/ Game launches in DosBOX - no true adaptation for Windows 7&8

Overall, very, very disappointing, IMO. If the graphics were as good as the Store Page screenshots (which they're not) and there was sound, I'd be happy with my purchase.
Howver, now I just feel ripped off and will buy no future titles from this company.
I should have paid more attention to the same complaints with Gunship!" regarding visuals in-game vs. store page screenshots.
Hell

hoursPlayed: and near enough to today's visuals to fool you of it's true age).\n\nBasically

reviewText:
A great game given new life. A couple of hints to improve gameplay. The game only runs slow because the CPU cycles in dosboox are set too low by default. To change this hit alt-enter while in game. This makes the window smaller so you can see the CPU count on the top left, it should read  3000. Hit Ctrl-F12 many times till it reaches a smooth frame rate, this is around 52301 for me. Hit alt-enter to return to full screen.

Alt-S  turns sound on and off in game.

F10 allows the detail levels to be set higher.

In campaign mode your supply and bombard task forces will change speed as they approach Henderson field without you ordering it. This is not a bug, this is done automatically by the computer to allow your ships to reach Guadalcanal at nighttime to avoid air attack.

There is a new patch update to the game which fixes some waypoint issues and comes with the manual.

Many times in battle, ships or columns under your control will not do what you want. Usually this happens when ships in formation take damage lose speed, jam their rudders or swerve to avoid damaged ships. It is frustrating but realistically frustrating!  The enjoyable part of this game for me is trying to keep the task force in organized-order throughout the battle. This rarely happens. It is easier to do this in later battles as the Americans as they have radar and can detect and fire upon the Japanese out of visual range.

If Japanese destroyers see you and illuminate you with flares, you will have torpedoes hitting you within a couple of minutes. Then you will die.

The ships and shells are really 3d not sprites. This means ships are damaged where they are hit and shells are tracked individually on their trajectory as they leave the guns all the way hit or miss.

If you were frustrated or appalled the first time you saw this game  read the manual play the tutorial and work yourself into it.

reviewText: An initially disappointing re-release of an old relic.  Oversights included a missing manual, an unapplied patch, unoptimized DOSBox settings, broken DRM and some extra" files.\n\nThis issues have thankfully been corrected
date: so I can recommend this game now... with caveats.\n\nThis is a direct-to-DOSBox dump of the 1992 game.  If you were expecting any modern updates or conveniences
recommended: you won't get them.\n\nTF: 1942 decent attempt at a WW2 3D naval simulator covering the crucial conflicts around Guadacanal.  These were brutal and often-confused (at least from the American side!) slugging matches between generally equal forces.  Historically
